headline: Block, Pinterest, Etsy, Target: Trending Tickers
summary: Shares of CashApp parent company Block (XYZ) are surging ahead of the stock's inclusion in the S&P 500 (^GSPC), replacing Hess (HES). Pinterest (PINS) and Etsy (ETSY) were both upgraded by Morgan Stanley analysts, who also lifted their price targets on each stock. Target (TGT) stock is in focus after Barclays downgraded the company to Underweight from Equal Weight, citing expected sales declines. headline: Block jumps after inclusion in S&P 500, a new milestone for fintech
summary: The inclusion cements Block's status as one of the most valuable and influential players in the fintech space, and shows how digital payments and financial apps have moved into the mainstream and disrupted traditional banking models in the U.S.  Block -- with a market value of about $44.8 billion -- will replace Hess Corp, following its $55 billion merger with oil major Chevron.  Shares of a company often rise after being added to the S&P 500 as index-tracking funds are required to add them to their portfolio, boosting demand for the stock.

raw.headline: Block jumps after inclusion in S&P 500, a new milestone for fintech
raw.summary: The inclusion cements Block's status as one of the most valuable and influential players in the fintech space, and shows how digital payments and financial apps have moved into the mainstream and disrupted traditional banking models in the U.S.  Block -- with a market value of about $44.8 billion -- will replace Hess Corp, following its $55 billion merger with oil major Chevron.  Shares of a company often rise after being added to the S&P 500 as index-tracking funds are required to add them to their portfolio, boosting demand for the stock.

headline: Stocks Set to Open Higher as Investors Await U.S. Economic Data and Tech Earnings, Trade Talks in Focus
summary: September S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESU25) are up +0.27%, and September Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQU25) are up +0.28% this morning, pointing to a higher open on Wall Street, while investors await more news on trade talks, a fresh batch of U.S. economic data, and a slew of corporate earnings reports, with a particular focus on results from “Magnificent Seven” stalwarts Tesla and Alphabet.
